etymology.description: Originally phono-semantic: semantic 貝 (“cowry”) + phonetic 𠂈; later 丁 was added as a second phonetic. 𠂈 → 十 (modern) / 匕 (seal); bottom from 貝 + 丁 → 目 + 丌.
etymology.interpretation: It began as a value-related graph with 貝 indicating preciousness and a blade-like 𠂈 providing the sound; 丁 later reinforced the phonetic side. Over time these parts were regularized into the modern shape with 十 over 目 and a base derived from older 貝/丁 forms, while the meaning shifted toward “genuine/true.”

examples.chinese: 他真喜欢你(他真喜歡你)。
我们终于找到了真相(我們終於找到了真相)。
